name: EuraMaterials
goal:
EuraMaterials is a competitiveness cluster, a company club, an incubator/accelerator and a place of reference in Northern Europe for advanced materials


Its mission is to facilitate and accelerate the emergence of new R&D projects, to support collaborative innovation projects from the setting up until obtaining the necessary funding and the market launch of new products, services or processes.

With 255 members, EuraMaterials has expertise in advanced materials for applications in 7 main industries: tableware and houseware appliance, packaging and printing industry, industry equipment, transport&mobility, building industry and health industries.

EuraMaterials gathers the know-how of companies (50% of the members) and research and technology organisations (40% of the members), and brings together researchers, academia, entrepreneurs and the civil society in mutualised labs and projects mixing fundamental and applied research on a multidisciplinary and cross-sectoral approach.

EuraMaterials supports its members to identify and beneficiate from adequate services for each profile and each situation:

- Facilitate networking

- Events: information or training sessions, round tables, seminars, conferences, technical seminars or workshops dedicated to the emergence of projects

- Technology watch and economic intelligence services

- Support for project development at regional, national and European level

- Visibility for EuraMaterials members in France and abroad

EuraMaterials finally offers to work under research or technical cooperation agreements with partners and is also open to collaborate on EU projects.
interests: Business and Industry, Consumers, Environment, Food Safety, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Sport, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
Matikem is particularly interested in :
- RIS3 implementation and monitoring (strategic territorial approach, regional funding mechanisms & synergies of EU funds)
- Entrepreneurship fostering support;
- Definition of topics retained in workprogramms (e.g. NMBP / Bioeconomy/ COSME / INETRREG);
- Support for acquisition of financial sources (R&D and innovation supporting programs, private fundraisings, access to business angels etc.);
- Internationalisation of SMEs .
